rows.Symptom: No friction, no heat generation
rows.Root Cause: Softwood drill not matched with hardwood board
rows.Fix/Solution: Match drill/board: pine drill with oak/maple board
rows.Prevention: Pre-test wood pairs, know local species
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should generate 40°C+ heat at contact point
rows.Recovery Strategy: Restart with fresh materials, dry thoroughly

rows.Symptom: Smoke but no ember, intermittent friction
rows.Root Cause: Operator pressing too lightly, inconsistent pressure
rows.Fix/Solution: Apply steady 25-40 lbs pressure, perpendicular motion
rows.Prevention: Practice pressure control, film yourself
rows.Quality Benchmark: Consistent brown dust accumulation immediately
rows.Recovery Strategy: Slow drill speed, increase pressure gradually

rows.Symptom: Heavy smoke, quick fire-out after transfer
rows.Fix/Solution: Use only kiln-dry or sun-dried materials
rows.Prevention: Store under cover, test moisture with finger
rows.Quality Benchmark: Materials break cleanly when bent sharply
rows.Recovery Strategy: Move to heated shelter, allow 24hr drying

rows.Symptom: Ember transferred but won't catch flame
rows.Fix/Solution: Fluff fibrous materials (cedar bark), loosely wrap
rows.Prevention: Store lint in dry containers, test fluffiness
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should be translucent when held to light
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add finer fibers, create air channels

rows.Symptom: Smolders, never reaches full flame
rows.Root Cause: Blocks oxygen access to burning materials
rows.Fix/Solution: Space kindling with 1-2cm gaps, create pyramid
rows.Prevention: Practice with wet wood first to see flow
rows.Quality Benchmark: Flames through structure within 30 seconds
rows.Recovery Strategy: Spread kindling, reduce density

rows.Symptom: Flames die when tinder burns out
rows.Root Cause: Heat insufficient to ignite next fuel stage
rows.Fix/Solution: Tighter lay, overlap kindling slightly
rows.Prevention: Use dry test materials, observe burn pattern
rows.Quality Benchmark: Smooth transition from tinder→kindling→fuel
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add intermediate size pieces

rows.Symptom: Fire burns but produces excessive smoke
rows.Root Cause: Moisture content >20%, wastes energy on evaporation
rows.Fix/Solution: Use dead wood, split open, test with knife
rows.Prevention: Maintain woodpile with cover, stock split wood
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should be lighter in weight, ring-dry sound
rows.Recovery Strategy: Switch to seasoned wood, increase fire size

rows.Symptom: Charcoal ignites too easily, burns too fast
rows.Fix/Solution: Use hardwoods: oak, maple, birch, or fruit wood
rows.Prevention: Identify wood species before processing
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should burn steady 8-10 minutes per piece
rows.Recovery Strategy: Mix with hardwood charcoal, control airflow

rows.Symptom: Charcoal partially unconverted, low heat output
rows.Fix/Solution: Bury in sand pit method, limit air access
rows.Prevention: Monitor flame color: white smoke=ready
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should be jet black, leave no ash residue
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-burn remaining material

rows.Symptom: Fire dies by morning from heat loss
rows.Root Cause: Ash layer too thin, loses heat to air
rows.Fix/Solution: Bank 2-3cm ash around coals, tamp lightly
rows.Prevention: Save fine ash, measure layer thickness
rows.Quality Benchmark: Coals alive after 12hr bank period
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add more ash, insulate with rocks

rows.Symptom: Fire dies from lack of oxygen
rows.Root Cause: Compacted ash blocks oxygen to coals
rows.Fix/Solution: Light ash dust only, don't tamp hard
rows.Prevention: Practice gently, test with airflow probe
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should smell charcoal scent (oxygen flow present)
rows.Recovery Strategy: Carefully remove top ash layer

rows.Symptom: Food burns outside, raw inside
rows.Fix/Solution: Use coals for steady cooking, flame for boil
rows.Prevention: Build separate coal bed, count hand-heat
rows.Quality Benchmark: Hold hand 6 inches above: 8 count=hot, 15 count=med
rows.Recovery Strategy: Move pot higher, use coals only

rows.Symptom: No sustained smolder, fire goes out
rows.Fix/Solution: Pre-stage all tinder, kindling, fuel before ignition
rows.Prevention: Use bark, dead grasses, completely dry items
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should produce thin white smoke for 5+ minutes
rows.Recovery Strategy: Focus on driest materials first

rows.Symptom: Heat absorbed by ground, camp stays cold
rows.Fix/Solution: Build rock/log reflector behind fire
rows.Prevention: Natural reflector planning during site selection
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should feel 40°F warmer 10 feet away with reflector
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add reflector after fire established

rows.Symptom: Fire control emergency becomes catastrophic
rows.Fix/Solution: Pre-stage water container, keep water nearby
rows.Prevention: Scout water source before fire building
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should be able to fully extinguish fire in 2 minutes
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use sand/dirt as backup extinguisher

rows.Symptom: Cloudy water, waterborne illness 24-72hrs later
rows.Root Cause: Filter media degraded or improperly layered
rows.Fix/Solution: Replace sand every 2-3 months, backflush regularly
rows.Prevention: Monitor water clarity daily, establish 30-day rotation
rows.Quality Benchmark: Output should be crystal clear, no visible particles
rows.Recovery Strategy: Immediately boil all water, rebuild filter from scratch

rows.Symptom: Water passes through without filtering
rows.Root Cause: Sand/gravel installed in wrong order (upside down)
rows.Fix/Solution: Top layer: fine sand, middle: coarse sand, bottom: gravel
rows.Prevention: Document layer sequence on filter housing
rows.Quality Benchmark: Should take 2-5 minutes to filter 1 liter
rows.Recovery Strategy: Disassemble and rebuild with correct sequence

rows.Symptom: Odor indicates bacterial/chemical contamination
rows.Root Cause: Sulfur bacteria or anaerobic decay in source
rows.Fix/Solution: Boil 10 minutes minimum, switch water source
rows.Prevention: Regular water testing, daily smell checks
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clear, odorless, no floating particles
rows.Recovery Strategy: Find new water source, treat chemically

rows.Symptom: Fine sediment clouds water after pumping
rows.Root Cause: Formation sand invades well during pump operation
rows.Fix/Solution: Install 2-3 feet gravel pack around screen
rows.Prevention: Use aquifer-appropriate gravel size (pre-test)
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water should clear within 5-10 minutes
rows.Recovery Strategy: Pump for extended period to settle sand

rows.Symptom: Well wall collapses into bore, water blocks flow
rows.Root Cause: Casing moves sideways, crushes at weak point
rows.Fix/Solution: Install rigid casing, backfill with gravel to surface
rows.Prevention: Use schedule 40 steel/PVC, gravel backfill plan
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water flows steady at original rate for 5+ years
rows.Recovery Strategy: Drill new well, abandon collapsed well properly

rows.Symptom: Pump runs but no water flows
rows.Root Cause: Air enters suction line instead of water
rows.Fix/Solution: Check all connections, tighten, use vacuum grease
rows.Prevention: Inspect line before installation, test prime
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water should flow within 30 seconds of priming
rows.Recovery Strategy: Apply vacuum with hand pump, refill reservoir

rows.Symptom: Green algae growth, sick animals/people
rows.Root Cause: First rainfall washes bird droppings, leaves into tank
rows.Fix/Solution: Divert first 50-100 gallons of rainfall to ground
rows.Prevention: Install debris screen at downspout, first-flush diverter
rows.Quality Benchmark: Tank water stays clear 6+ months without treatment
rows.Recovery Strategy: Drain tank, clean walls with brush, disinfect

rows.Symptom: Green water, bitter taste, intestinal issues
rows.Root Cause: Light exposure allows photosynthesis in stored water
rows.Fix/Solution: Use opaque tank (no light penetration)
rows.Prevention: Cover tank, paint dark color, install UV cover
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water stays clear for 12+ months in storage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Drain and clean tank, install UV light or cover

rows.Symptom: No water flow in winter, cracked pipe ends
rows.Root Cause: Water expands as it freezes, splits pipe
rows.Fix/Solution: Insulate with foam wrapping 2+ inches thick, drain system
rows.Prevention: Winter prep: drain lines or add antifreeze
rows.Quality Benchmark: Pipes survive -20°F without damage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Thaw carefully with warm (not hot) water, replace section

rows.Symptom: Slimy pipe interior, brown water flow initially
rows.Root Cause: Bacteria/algae colonies form in static water
rows.Fix/Solution: Flush lines weekly, treat with dilute bleach monthly
rows.Prevention: Keep system active, regular disinfection routine
rows.Quality Benchmark: Flowing water stays clear, no smell or discoloration
rows.Recovery Strategy: Backflush system, chlorinate, flush for 24hr

rows.Common Mistake: Well too close to coast/saline aquifer
rows.Symptom: Salty taste develops over time, increasing
rows.Root Cause: Pumping lowers water table, allows salt water in
rows.Fix/Solution: Move well inland, deeper aquifer selection
rows.Prevention: Hydrogeological survey before drilling location
rows.Quality Benchmark: Stable salinity levels year-round (PPM unchanged)
rows.Recovery Strategy: Drill new well in better location, cap old well

rows.Symptom: Taste changes to plastic flavor, reduced clarity
rows.Root Cause: UV light and heat break down polymer bonds
rows.Fix/Solution: Use approved food-grade, UV-resistant containers
rows.Prevention: Store in shade, use opaque dark containers
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water tastes clean, no plastic flavor after 2 years
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace degraded tank, switch to approved material

rows.Symptom: Downstream well shows soap/detergent, illness
rows.Root Cause: Improper drain-field design allows pathogens to seep
rows.Fix/Solution: Use appropriate soil type, 3-4 feet drain-field depth
rows.Prevention: Test soil percolation rate, design proper system
rows.Quality Benchmark: Downstream wells test clean for 5+ year cycle
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install proper septic/wetland treatment system

rows.Symptom: Water flow drops below requirement
rows.Fix/Solution: Replace cartridge every 6-12 months based on use
rows.Prevention: Check flow rate monthly, maintain replacement schedule
rows.Quality Benchmark: Flow rate stays above 5 GPM continuously
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install new cartridge, document replacement date

rows.Symptom: Rotten egg smell, brown discoloration appears
rows.Root Cause: Oxygen depletion allows sulfur bacteria growth
rows.Fix/Solution: Install aeration fountain, circulation pump
rows.Prevention: Keep storage in motion, add airstone daily
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water stays clear, odor-free, taste fresh
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase aeration, add activated carbon filter

rows.Symptom: Water pools on roof, eventual leaks into structure
rows.Root Cause: Snow/water can't drain adequately on flat surfaces
rows.Fix/Solution: Install 4:12 pitch minimum (20 degrees)
rows.Prevention: Design for local climate, use engineer calculations
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water drains completely after heavy rain
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reinstall with steeper angle or add drainage channels

rows.Symptom: Water drips into attic space after rain
rows.Fix/Solution: Replace shingles with overlap, seal edges
rows.Prevention: Annual roof inspection, immediate damage repair
rows.Quality Benchmark: No moisture in attic, water stains disappear
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace damaged shingles, seal flashing

rows.Symptom: Water enters at roof penetrations or seams
rows.Fix/Solution: Use metal flashing with proper overlap and seal
rows.Prevention: Install flashing first, shingles over top
rows.Quality Benchmark: Flashing stays dry during heavy rain
rows.Recovery Strategy: Remove old flashing, reinstall with sealant

rows.Symptom: Cracks in walls, doors/windows misalign
rows.Root Cause: Ground heaves when water freezes in soil
rows.Fix/Solution: Dig below frost line (varies by region: 18-48 inches)
rows.Prevention: Know local frost depth, dig appropriately deep
rows.Quality Benchmark: No foundation cracking after 5+ winters
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install drainage to prevent water accumulation

rows.Common Mistake: Logs in contact with soil or constant moisture
rows.Symptom: Soft spots in wood, dark discoloration, fungal growth
rows.Root Cause: Fungal decay requires moisture and wood contact
rows.Fix/Solution: Keep logs elevated 18+ inches, use rot-resistant species
rows.Prevention: Annual inspection, ventilate between logs
rows.Quality Benchmark: Wood stays hard, no soft spots when probed
rows.Recovery Strategy: Remove and replace affected log sections

rows.Common Mistake: Too much sand in cob mix (shrinkage)
rows.Symptom: Large radial cracks during drying, structural weakness
rows.Root Cause: Excess sand causes differential drying stress
rows.Fix/Solution: Use 1:3 clay:sand ratio by volume, test first
rows.Prevention: Sample test batch, monitor drying pattern
rows.Quality Benchmark: Hairline cracks only (<1mm), stable after 3 months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reinforce with additional straw, slower drying

rows.Symptom: Cracks in curved sections, reduced tensile strength
rows.Root Cause: Not enough fiber to resist cracking
rows.Fix/Solution: Mix 1-2 hands full straw per bucket of cob
rows.Prevention: Feel straw distribution, visual inspection
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cracks <1/16 inch, even distribution of cracks
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add more straw, smaller batches with more fiber

rows.Symptom: Reduced R-value, visible mold on interior
rows.Root Cause: Warm moist air reaches cold surface, condenses
rows.Fix/Solution: Install vapor barrier on warm side, ensure ventilation
rows.Prevention: Seal air leaks, monitor humidity levels
rows.Quality Benchmark: Insulation stays dry, no moisture visible
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add dehumidifier, increase ventilation

rows.Symptom: R-value decreases with time, warm spots appear
rows.Root Cause: Material compacts under its own weight
rows.Fix/Solution: Use rigid insulation or blown-in with binder
rows.Prevention: Inspect annually for settling, add more if needed
rows.Quality Benchmark: R-value remains constant for 20+ years
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-install with settling-resistant material

rows.Common Mistake: Chimney too short for building height
rows.Symptom: Smoke back-drafting into living space
rows.Root Cause: Insufficient pressure difference to pull air out
rows.Fix/Solution: Chimney top must be 3 feet above roof peak
rows.Prevention: Calculate required height before construction
rows.Quality Benchmark: Smoke flows smoothly up and out, no back-draft
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add vertical extension to chimney

rows.Symptom: Slow draft or incomplete combustion
rows.Root Cause: Oversized chimney cools smoke too much
rows.Fix/Solution: Match chimney diameter to stove/fireplace spec
rows.Prevention: Consult engineer or use established formulas
rows.Quality Benchmark: Negative pressure in firebox, steady flame
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install properly sized liner or rebuild chimney

rows.Symptom: Air leaks, heat loss, drafts during wind
rows.Fix/Solution: Weatherstrip and caulk gaps, use flexible sealant
rows.Prevention: Seasonal adjustment, maintain weatherstripping
rows.Quality Benchmark: No air movement through cracks, draft-free
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-align frame, replace weatherstripping

rows.Symptom: Moisture wicks up into walls, causes rot
rows.Root Cause: Water travels through concrete/stone by capillary action
rows.Fix/Solution: Install polyethylene membrane on sill plate
rows.Prevention: Use moisture barrier before wall construction
rows.Quality Benchmark: Sill plate stays dry, no visible moisture
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install membrane retrofit if not present

rows.Symptom: Uneven foundation settling, wall cracks widen
rows.Root Cause: Soft soil compresses under load unevenly
rows.Fix/Solution: Geotechnical test before building, proper foundation
rows.Prevention: Professional soil analysis, engineered design
rows.Quality Benchmark: Structure level within 1/4 inch over 20 feet
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install foundation piers to undisturbed soil

rows.Symptom: Deep radial cracks in timber (checking)
rows.Root Cause: Outer wood dries faster than inner core
rows.Fix/Solution: Allow slow drying (1 year per inch of thickness)
rows.Prevention: Stack with spacers, cover during rain only
rows.Quality Benchmark: Surface cracks shallow (<1/4 inch deep)
rows.Recovery Strategy: Accept as normal, monitor for structural impact

rows.Symptom: Pullout as wood shrinks, structural failure
rows.Root Cause: End grain has weak holding power
rows.Fix/Solution: Fasten perpendicular to grain, use bolts in critical areas
rows.Prevention: Engineer fastener placement for grain direction
rows.Quality Benchmark: Fasteners hold for entire lifespan, no loosening
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use larger bolts, add washers, reduce spacing

rows.Symptom: Wet basement/crawlspace, mold growth
rows.Root Cause: Groundwater pressure forces water through walls
rows.Fix/Solution: Install perimeter drain, sloped grade, sump pump
rows.Prevention: Grade sloped away 5+ feet from building
rows.Quality Benchmark: Basement stays dry during heavy rain
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install sump pump, exterior drain tile

rows.Symptom: Sagging floors, ceiling deflection visible
rows.Fix/Solution: Engineer framing design, use proper dimensions
rows.Prevention: Calculate loads, consult wood engineering tables
rows.Quality Benchmark: No visible deflection under design load
rows.Recovery Strategy: Install additional posts/beams to support

rows.Symptom: Water damage to wall and foundation
rows.Fix/Solution: Minimum 18-24 inches overhang, more in rain climates
rows.Prevention: Design overhangs based on precipitation intensity
rows.Quality Benchmark: No water stains on walls below eaves
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add fascia extensions or rebuild with greater overhang

rows.Symptom: Water seeps through, deterioration spreads
rows.Fix/Solution: Seal all cracks with polyurethane or epoxy
rows.Prevention: Annual inspection, seal cracks immediately
rows.Quality Benchmark: Concrete stays dry, no new staining
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-seal cracks, address root cause of movement

rows.Common Mistake: Processing low-acid foods at too low temperature
rows.Symptom: Botulism toxin produced, possibly fatal
rows.Root Cause: Clostridium botulinum spores survive insufficient heat
rows.Fix/Solution: Use pressure canner at 10 PSI for 20-30 minutes minimum
rows.Prevention: Follow USDA/Ball guide exactly, no shortcuts
rows.Quality Benchmark: Jars sealed tight, contents smell/taste normal 1 year later
rows.Recovery Strategy: DISCARD contents if any doubt, start over

rows.Common Mistake: Improper pH not verified (foods not acidic enough)
rows.Symptom: C. botulinum can grow in low-acid environment
rows.Root Cause: Didn't test or verify pH, assumed safe acidity
rows.Fix/Solution: Test pH with meter or use commercial lemon juice
rows.Prevention: Acidify with lemon/vinegar, verify with pH paper
rows.Quality Benchmark: pH consistently <4.6, confirmed with testing
rows.Recovery Strategy: DISCARD and reprocess, test all batches

rows.Symptom: Bacteria enter after processing, create toxins
rows.Fix/Solution: Use new lids, proper screw-band tension, full immersion
rows.Prevention: Check seals after 24 hours, discard unsealed jars
rows.Quality Benchmark: All jars sealed tightly, no loosening over time
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reprocess unsealed jars immediately or discard

rows.Symptom: Under-processing, spoilage organisms survive
rows.Root Cause: Didn't adjust for elevation (higher altitude = longer time)
rows.Fix/Solution: Add 5 minutes per 1000 feet elevation above sea level
rows.Prevention: Know elevation, consult processing guides
rows.Quality Benchmark: Jars properly sealed, contents stable for 1+ years
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reprocess immediately, increase time based on altitude

rows.Symptom: Moldy taste, ruined batch
rows.Fix/Solution: Submerge vegetables under brine, use weight/cloth
rows.Prevention: Keep vegetables completely under brine always
rows.Quality Benchmark: White/gray KAHM yeast acceptable, green mold = failure
rows.Recovery Strategy: Start over, skim kahm yeast, ensure submersion

rows.Symptom: Sour taste, unpleasant odor
rows.Fix/Solution: Salt ratio 3-5% by weight, maintain temperature 60-75°F
rows.Prevention: Measure salt precisely, monitor temperature
rows.Quality Benchmark: Pleasant sour taste, clean fermentation smell
rows.Recovery Strategy: Start new batch with better salt/temperature control

rows.Symptom: Batch ruins quickly, bitter/off taste
rows.Root Cause: Contamination and gas production indicate spoilage
rows.Fix/Solution: Use proper salt, clean jars, weight vegetables down
rows.Prevention: Sanitize all equipment, test salt concentration
rows.Quality Benchmark: No gas bubbles, only mold-free white yeast
rows.Recovery Strategy: Discard batch, redo with strict sanitation

rows.Symptom: Jerky texture spongy, surface stays moist
rows.Root Cause: Drying incomplete, moisture allows bacterial growth
rows.Fix/Solution: Maintain 160-180°F smoker temperature minimum
rows.Prevention: Use thermometer, monitor temperature constantly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Jerky bends but doesn't break, completely dry
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase temperature, extend smoking time

rows.Symptom: Jerky case-hardens (hard outside, moist inside)
rows.Root Cause: High heat seals surface, traps moisture inside
rows.Fix/Solution: Keep below 165°F, use lower temperature for longer time
rows.Prevention: Monitor with thermometer, control heat source
rows.Quality Benchmark: Jerky dries evenly, flexes without breaking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reduce temperature, increase drying time

rows.Symptom: Spoilage at edges where salt didn't penetrate
rows.Root Cause: Bacterial growth where salt concentration insufficient
rows.Fix/Solution: Use 20% salt by weight (minimum), fully immerse
rows.Prevention: Weigh salt precisely, ensure complete coverage
rows.Quality Benchmark: No discoloration, no odor, lasts 6+ months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reprocess with proper salt concentration

rows.Common Mistake: Uneven drying (some pieces moist, some over-dried)
rows.Symptom: Mold in thick pieces, over-dried thin pieces
rows.Fix/Solution: Cut uniform thickness, maintain consistent 140-160°F
rows.Prevention: Arrange pieces for even airflow, rotate trays
rows.Quality Benchmark: All pieces finish drying simultaneously
rows.Recovery Strategy: Redo with consistent thickness and temperature

rows.Symptom: Soft spots appear weeks after drying
rows.Root Cause: Humidity in storage container allows moisture regain
rows.Fix/Solution: Store in airtight container with desiccant (silica gel)
rows.Prevention: Keep in cool dry place, vacuum seal if available
rows.Quality Benchmark: Product stays crispy in storage for 6+ months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-dry if necessary, use desiccant in storage

rows.Symptom: Vegetables sprout/decay faster, short storage
rows.Fix/Solution: Maintain 32-50°F with proper ventilation/insulation
rows.Prevention: Install thermometer/hygrometer, monitor daily
rows.Quality Benchmark: Root vegetables store 4-6 months, stable condition
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add insulation, improve ventilation, vent at night

rows.Symptom: Vegetables freeze, texture destroyed
rows.Fix/Solution: Ensure temperature >32°F, close vents in freeze events
rows.Prevention: Install damper system, monitor cold snaps
rows.Quality Benchmark: No frozen vegetables, proper texture after storage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Warm space before freezing, control ventilation

rows.Symptom: Mold/fungal growth, rot develops quickly
rows.Fix/Solution: Ventilate with dry air, reduce humidity to 60-75%
rows.Prevention: Add desiccant or ventilation adjustments
rows.Quality Benchmark: Vegetables stay dry, no mold after 6 months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Improve ventilation, add calcium chloride desiccant

rows.Symptom: Hard lumps form in honey, poor texture
rows.Fix/Solution: Store at room temperature (60-75°F), seal tightly
rows.Prevention: Normal process, honey still safe and usable
rows.Quality Benchmark: Liquid honey or easily re-meltable crystallized form
rows.Recovery Strategy: Warm gently (never boil), dissolves crystals

rows.Symptom: Vinegar becomes murky, jelly-like substance forms
rows.Root Cause: Acetic acid bacteria create cellulose mother
rows.Fix/Solution: Strain out mother, store in cool dark place sealed
rows.Prevention: Keep air exposure minimal, filter regularly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clear vinegar, potent acidity for 2+ years
rows.Recovery Strategy: Strain mother out, rebottle cleanly

rows.Symptom: Off smell, bitter taste in oil
rows.Fix/Solution: Store in dark glass, full bottle (minimal air), cool place
rows.Prevention: Keep away from light/heat, buy fresh regularly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Oil smells fresh, clean taste, no rancid smell
rows.Recovery Strategy: Discard, replace with fresh oil, improve storage

rows.Symptom: Cheese too dry and crumbly
rows.Root Cause: Temperature raised too fast, squeezed moisture out
rows.Fix/Solution: Raise temperature slowly (5°F/10 minutes), gentle cutting
rows.Prevention: Monitor temperature, cut curds uniformly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cheese moist and slightly soft, proper crumble
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add back whey, reduce temperature next batch

rows.Symptom: Cheese won't set, mushy texture
rows.Fix/Solution: Use proper rennet amount, maintain 86°F exactly
rows.Prevention: Test batch, calibrate temperature, measure rennet
rows.Quality Benchmark: Firm curd forms in 30 minutes, clean break
rows.Recovery Strategy: Redo batch, verify rennet activity and temperature

rows.Symptom: Seeds don't sprout, blank spots in garden
rows.Fix/Solution: Test germination before planting (wet paper towel)
rows.Prevention: Store seeds in cool dry place, use 1-2 year old max
rows.Quality Benchmark: 90%+ germination rate in viability test
rows.Recovery Strategy: Buy fresh seeds, replant with new seed stock

rows.Symptom: Seeds never emerge, rot in soil
rows.Root Cause: Too much soil weight prevents emergence
rows.Fix/Solution: Plant 2-3 times seed diameter deep
rows.Prevention: Shallow seed trench, cover lightly with soil
rows.Quality Benchmark: 90%+ emergence rate, uniform seedling height
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replant at correct depth, ensure loose soil

rows.Symptom: Uneven germination, some rot, some fail
rows.Root Cause: Too wet/dry kills seeds, inconsistent conditions
rows.Fix/Solution: Keep soil moist not wet, maintain consistent moisture
rows.Prevention: Check daily, drip irrigation better than hand-watering
rows.Quality Benchmark: All seeds emerge simultaneously, 95%+ rate
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replant with consistent water management

rows.Symptom: Plants wilt, pale leaves, slow growth recovery
rows.Root Cause: Roots torn or severed during removal
rows.Fix/Solution: Use water-in-hole method, plant with soil intact
rows.Prevention: Handle seedlings by leaves only, keep root ball intact
rows.Quality Benchmark: Transplant recovers growth within 2 weeks
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replant carefully, use transplant fertilizer

rows.Symptom: Leaves bleach/burn (sun intolerant) or stretch (shade hungry)
rows.Root Cause: Didn't match plant needs to site conditions
rows.Fix/Solution: Harden off seedlings, place in appropriate light
rows.Prevention: Scout locations before planting, know plant requirements
rows.Quality Benchmark: Healthy growth within 3 weeks, proper color
rows.Recovery Strategy: Move to correct location or provide shade cloth

rows.Symptom: Yellow leaves, wilting despite wet soil, poor growth
rows.Fix/Solution: Let soil dry between waterings (1-2 inches deep)
rows.Prevention: Test soil moisture, use drip irrigation, improve drainage
rows.Quality Benchmark: Soil dries to 1-2 inches between waterings
rows.Recovery Strategy: Improve drainage, reduce watering frequency

rows.Symptom: Dry crispy leaves, stunted plant development
rows.Fix/Solution: Water deeply 2-3 times per week (soil dependent)
rows.Prevention: Check soil moisture daily in heat, water to 6 inches deep
rows.Quality Benchmark: Soil moist to 6 inches deep, turgid leaves
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase watering frequency/depth

rows.Symptom: Pale green to yellow foliage, poor growth
rows.Fix/Solution: Add nitrogen fertilizer (compost, manure, synthetic)
rows.Prevention: Soil test annually, maintain fertility with amendments
rows.Quality Benchmark: Deep green foliage, vigorous growth
rows.Recovery Strategy: Apply fertilizer, wait 2-3 weeks for recovery

rows.Symptom: Sticky residue, curled leaves, virus spread risk
rows.Fix/Solution: Spray neem oil, insecticidal soap, or release ladybugs
rows.Prevention: Scout weekly, early small-population control
rows.Quality Benchmark: No visible aphids for 3-4 week cycles
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase spray frequency, try different organic product

rows.Symptom: Defoliation, reduced yield
rows.Fix/Solution: Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) spray, hand removal
rows.Prevention: Check undersides of leaves weekly, early intervention
rows.Quality Benchmark: No more than 5% leaf damage, no visible frass
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase Bt applications, improve monitoring

rows.Symptom: Reduced photosynthesis, leaf death, yield loss
rows.Fix/Solution: Sulfur dust or potassium bicarbonate spray
rows.Prevention: Improve air circulation, water at soil level only
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clean foliage, no white powder visible after week
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-apply fungicide, improve plant spacing

rows.Symptom: Rapid plant death, spread to other plants
rows.Fix/Solution: Remove infected parts immediately, destroy, apply copper
rows.Prevention: Ensure good drainage, avoid wet foliage, sanitize tools
rows.Quality Benchmark: No new symptoms within 2 weeks of treatment
rows.Recovery Strategy: Remove entire plant if severe, improve spacing

rows.Symptom: Nutrient exhaustion from repeated planting
rows.Root Cause: Harvesting removes soil nutrients without replacement
rows.Fix/Solution: Add compost, manure, cover crops, crop rotation
rows.Prevention: Soil test every 2 years, maintain organic matter
rows.Quality Benchmark: Test shows balanced NPK, organic matter >5%
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add amendments, implement rotation schedule

rows.Symptom: Water pools, shallow rooting, stunted growth
rows.Root Cause: Soil particles compressed, pore space reduced
rows.Fix/Solution: Loosen with broadfork or tiller, add organic matter
rows.Prevention: Avoid traffic when wet, mulch surface
rows.Quality Benchmark: Water infiltrates >1 inch per hour, roots reach 12 inches
rows.Recovery Strategy: Aerate with tiller, add compost, reduce traffic

rows.Symptom: Methane smell, slow decomposition, anaerobic bacteria
rows.Fix/Solution: Add dry materials (straw, leaves), turn pile
rows.Prevention: Moisture like wrung-out sponge not soggy
rows.Quality Benchmark: Earthy smell, warm pile, decomposition in 2-3 months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add more dry matter, turn more frequently

rows.Symptom: Pile dormant, takes 6+ months to break down
rows.Root Cause: Insufficient moisture for microbes to work
rows.Fix/Solution: Water to wrung-out sponge moisture, turns regularly
rows.Prevention: Monitor moisture, turn every 2 weeks
rows.Quality Benchmark: Warm pile, earthy smell, complete in 3 months
rows.Recovery Strategy: Add water, turn more frequently, monitor moisture

rows.Common Mistake: Slow decomposition or strong ammonia smell
rows.Symptom: Too much green (nitrogen) or too much brown (carbon)
rows.Fix/Solution: Mix 3 parts brown (leaves) to 1 part green (grass)
rows.Prevention: Layer materials, weigh amounts initially
rows.Quality Benchmark: No smell issues, proper decomposition rate
rows.Recovery Strategy: Adjust ratio, turn pile more frequently

rows.Symptom: Same pests appear, nutrients depleted, low yields
rows.Root Cause: Planting same family in same spot
rows.Fix/Solution: Rotate plant families (Nightshade/Legume/Brassica/Root)
rows.Prevention: Plan 3-4 year rotation schedule, document plantings
rows.Quality Benchmark: Healthy plants, no pest buildup, improved yields
rows.Recovery Strategy: Implement formal rotation, refer to plan annually

rows.Common Mistake: Unexpected plant characteristics in next generation
rows.Symptom: Plants don't match parent type (crossed with neighbor)
rows.Fix/Solution: Isolate flowering plants, use bags during anthesis
rows.Prevention: Distance (200+ feet for open-pollinated), timing
rows.Quality Benchmark: Offspring match parent plant characteristics
rows.Recovery Strategy: Be aware of cross-pollination source, accept variation

rows.Common Mistake: Seeds not fully mature, low germination
rows.Symptom: Seeds don't sprout well, weak seedlings
rows.Root Cause: Harvested before natural drying on plant
rows.Fix/Solution: Wait until seed pod dries on plant, turns brown/papery
rows.Prevention: Visual inspection, crispness test, shake test
rows.Quality Benchmark: 90%+ germination rate in stored seeds
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-harvest at full maturity, test germination

rows.Symptom: Metal doesn't bend easily, cracks when struck
rows.Fix/Solution: Add fuel, increase air flow, use bellows harder
rows.Prevention: Watch color progression: black→cherry red→bright red
rows.Quality Benchmark: Metal bends without cracking, glows cherry red
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase bellows strokes, add more coal

rows.Symptom: Metal burns/oxidizes heavily, becomes crumbly
rows.Root Cause: Excessive heat burns carbon out of steel
rows.Fix/Solution: Reduce air flow, remove some fuel, use less aggressive bellows
rows.Prevention: Pull back from intense heat zone, control air
rows.Quality Benchmark: Minimal scale formation, metal holds together
rows.Recovery Strategy: Move metal to cooler zone, reduce bellows intensity

rows.Symptom: Hardness insufficient, blade stays soft
rows.Root Cause: Slow cooling doesn't form proper martensite
rows.Fix/Solution: Use fresh cold water, stir vigorously during quench
rows.Prevention: Prepare fresh water bucket before heat cycle
rows.Quality Benchmark: Blade scratches glass (hardness test), can't be bent
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-heat and quench, ensure cold water agitation

rows.Common Mistake: Quenching oil too cool or viscous
rows.Symptom: Steel doesn't harden properly
rows.Root Cause: Oil cooling rate insufficient for carbon steel
rows.Fix/Solution: Use proper hardening oil heated to 150-200°C
rows.Prevention: Use dedicated hardening oil, monitor temperature
rows.Quality Benchmark: Blade file-hard, resists deep scoring
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use correct oil, reheat and quench properly

rows.Symptom: Steel shatters instead of bending
rows.Root Cause: Martensite structure too rigid, no ductility
rows.Fix/Solution: Temper steel: heat to 200-300°C (straw color) then cool
rows.Prevention: Watch color carefully: pale yellow→straw→purple
rows.Quality Benchmark: Blade bends before breaking, holds edge
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-temper at proper color, balance hardness/toughness

rows.Symptom: Some areas hard, others soft, uneven brittleness
rows.Fix/Solution: Normalize: heat to cherry red, air cool slowly 2-3x
rows.Prevention: Even cooling in still air, repeat cycles
rows.Quality Benchmark: Uniform hardness throughout, no spots of brittleness
rows.Recovery Strategy: Repeat normalize cycles until uniform

rows.Symptom: Crack appears under load, incomplete bonding
rows.Root Cause: Metal not hot enough to fuse, just pressed together
rows.Fix/Solution: Reheat to bright yellow, flux both surfaces, strike hard
rows.Prevention: Visual inspection, color matched on both surfaces
rows.Quality Benchmark: Weld holds under bend/strike test, strong connection
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reweld with proper heat and flux

rows.Symptom: Weak weld point, cracks initiate from voids
rows.Root Cause: Gas trapped in cooling weld metal
rows.Fix/Solution: Strike flux-covered weld multiple times, remove impurities
rows.Prevention: Proper flux coating, clean surfaces
rows.Quality Benchmark: Solid structure, no visible porosity on break test
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reweld, clean surfaces thoroughly

rows.Symptom: Bellows output weak, can't reach forging heat
rows.Fix/Solution: Repair/replace valve seals, use leather washers
rows.Prevention: Inspect valves regularly, test seal
rows.Quality Benchmark: Full volume air output, reaches full cherry red heat
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace valve seals or rebuild bellows

rows.Symptom: Air escapes sideways instead of in forge
rows.Root Cause: Metal fatigued from vibration or impact
rows.Fix/Solution: Repair weld at nozzle, reinforce if needed
rows.Prevention: Careful welding, don't overheat nozzle area
rows.Quality Benchmark: No air leakage, full pressure to forge
rows.Recovery Strategy: Weld carefully or replace bellows nozzle

rows.Symptom: Metal deforms instead of bouncing back
rows.Fix/Solution: Dress anvil with grinder/file to smooth surface
rows.Prevention: Use proper striking techniques, avoid dropping
rows.Quality Benchmark: Smooth surface, hammer bounces properly
rows.Recovery Strategy: Dress surface smooth or accept cosmetic damage

rows.Symptom: Cutting edge shatters when struck
rows.Fix/Solution: Draw temper lower: reheat to straw/pale yellow
rows.Prevention: Watch color carefully, stop at right point
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cuts smoothly, holds edge, doesn't shatter
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-temper at lower temperature

rows.Symptom: Edge doesn't hold, dulls immediately
rows.Fix/Solution: Reheat to bright cherry red, then cool to straw color
rows.Prevention: Observe color change, reach proper temper
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cuts cleanly for extended use, good edge retention
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reach proper temper temperature

rows.Common Mistake: File becomes dull, won't cut properly
rows.Symptom: File glances off work instead of cutting
rows.Root Cause: Hardness lost from over-heating or over-use
rows.Fix/Solution: Replace file (can't reharden easily), or re-harden
rows.Prevention: Use files within capacity, store safely
rows.Quality Benchmark: File cuts smoothly for 100+ hours use
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace file, don't exceed use limits

rows.Common Mistake: Handle comes loose or head slips
rows.Symptom: Head flies off during work (safety hazard)
rows.Fix/Solution: Reinstall wedges, use metal/wood wedges to secure
rows.Prevention: Check wedges regularly, re-tighten as needed
rows.Quality Benchmark: Hammer head solid for 1000+ strikes
rows.Recovery Strategy: Maintain wedges, check before each use

rows.Symptom: Pots crack during firing from trapped air expansion
rows.Root Cause: Air bubbles remain in clay body
rows.Fix/Solution: Wedge thoroughly 15-20 times, watch for bubbles
rows.Prevention: Consistent texture, no visible air pockets
rows.Quality Benchmark: No cracks from air expansion after firing
rows.Recovery Strategy: Rewedge thoroughly before next use

rows.Symptom: Cracks during throwing, won't stick together
rows.Fix/Solution: Add water gradually, knead thoroughly
rows.Prevention: Clay feels smooth, sticks when pressed
rows.Quality Benchmark: Works smoothly on wheel, joins without cracking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-hydrate carefully, knead to even moisture

rows.Symptom: Cracks radiate from center or edges curl
rows.Root Cause: Outer layer dries faster than interior
rows.Fix/Solution: Dry slowly in shade, cover loosely with plastic
rows.Prevention: Even moisture throughout, slow drying over days
rows.Quality Benchmark: No cracks after bone-dry stage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Dry in shade, increase drying time

rows.Symptom: Thin sections fire-hard before thick sections ready
rows.Fix/Solution: Uniform wall thickness, consistent drying environment
rows.Prevention: Even thickness design, covered drying area
rows.Quality Benchmark: All sections bone-dry simultaneously
rows.Recovery Strategy: Redesign for uniform thickness

rows.Symptom: Pots explode violently 50-100°C, kiln damage
rows.Root Cause: Water inside clay hasn't fully escaped
rows.Fix/Solution: Slow heating ramp (100°C/hour) below 200°C
rows.Prevention: Extended water smoking phase, proper ventilation
rows.Quality Benchmark: No explosions, smooth temperature ramp
rows.Recovery Strategy: Extend low-temp hold, monitor for steam

rows.Symptom: Glaze runs off, pots warp or melt to shelf
rows.Fix/Solution: Use pyrometric cones, calibrate kiln temperature
rows.Prevention: Monitor cones during firing, control temperature
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cones bend correctly, glaze stays in place
rows.Recovery Strategy: Lower temperature, verify cone calibration

rows.Symptom: Glaze doesn't melt, stays powdery and rough
rows.Fix/Solution: Increase firing temperature, hold longer
rows.Prevention: Use proper temperature for glaze type
rows.Quality Benchmark: Glaze melts fully, smooth glossy surface
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase temperature or extend firing time

rows.Symptom: Glaze runs off pieces, collects on shelf
rows.Fix/Solution: Dip 2-5 seconds or spray thin coating
rows.Prevention: Brush-apply with multiple thin coats vs single thick
rows.Quality Benchmark: Glaze stays on piece, no shelf sticking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Apply thinner coats, test specific gravity

rows.Symptom: Rough powdery surface, color weak
rows.Fix/Solution: Dip longer or apply multiple coats
rows.Prevention: Test glaze application thickness with samples
rows.Quality Benchmark: Smooth glossy surface, consistent color
rows.Recovery Strategy: Apply thicker coating, increase dip time

rows.Symptom: Fine cracks form in glaze surface
rows.Fix/Solution: Adjust glaze recipe: increase feldspar/flux
rows.Prevention: Test glaze on test tiles before production
rows.Quality Benchmark: No crazing visible after firing and cooling
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reformulate glaze with proper fit

rows.Symptom: Glaze flakes off edges and curves
rows.Fix/Solution: Reduce flux, increase silica in glaze
rows.Prevention: Glaze fit test before full production
rows.Quality Benchmark: Glaze stays firmly attached
rows.Recovery Strategy: Adjust glaze recipe composition

rows.Symptom: Blotchy or streaky glaze coloration
rows.Root Cause: Uneven glaze application or firing conditions
rows.Fix/Solution: Apply glaze evenly, ensure consistent kiln temperature
rows.Prevention: Even application, good air circulation in kiln
rows.Quality Benchmark: Uniform color across all pieces
rows.Recovery Strategy: Re-apply glaze evenly, verify kiln hotspots

rows.Symptom: Cracks from normal handling/impact
rows.Fix/Solution: Build with minimum 1/4 inch walls on vessels
rows.Prevention: Uniform thickness, strengthen base/stress areas
rows.Quality Benchmark: Survives normal use and mild impacts
rows.Recovery Strategy: Rebuild with thicker walls

rows.Common Mistake: Sharp foot cuts hands during use
rows.Symptom: Injury risk, uncomfortable to hold
rows.Fix/Solution: Sand foot smooth, wipe with damp sponge
rows.Prevention: Smooth all edges before glaze firing
rows.Quality Benchmark: Smooth foot, safe to handle repeatedly
rows.Recovery Strategy: Sand smooth, refire if needed or accept

rows.Symptom: Lips no longer match, bases warp up
rows.Fix/Solution: Use kiln shelves, proper support, even heating
rows.Prevention: Proper shelf placement, thermal cycling
rows.Quality Benchmark: Pieces hold shape after firing
rows.Recovery Strategy: Rebuild support system in kiln

rows.Common Mistake: Snare too high or too low
rows.Symptom: Animal avoids or jumps over snare
rows.Fix/Solution: Set loop 4-6 inches above ground for rabbits
rows.Prevention: Know prey height, test with hand placement
rows.Quality Benchmark: Consistent captures, snare catches around neck
rows.Recovery Strategy: Adjust height for specific animal

rows.Symptom: No captures, animal takes alternate route
rows.Fix/Solution: Scout area for droppings, tracks, worn paths
rows.Prevention: Visual observation, follow game signs
rows.Quality Benchmark: Frequent captures indicate good placement
rows.Recovery Strategy: Relocate snare along confirmed trail

rows.Symptom: Bow accuracy poor, arrow flies crooked
rows.Fix/Solution: Shave stiffer limb, match bend to other side
rows.Prevention: Visual inspection while bending, photo comparison
rows.Quality Benchmark: Both limbs bend equally, symmetrical curve
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reshave stiff limb, retest repeatedly

rows.Symptom: Guard slips, catches arm during release
rows.Fix/Solution: Tighten straps, ensure snug fit above elbow
rows.Prevention: Test fit while drawing, prevent arm rotation
rows.Quality Benchmark: Guard stays in place throughout draw/release
rows.Recovery Strategy: Retighten straps or replace with better fit

rows.Common Mistake: Arrows too stiff or too flexible
rows.Symptom: Arrow bends excessively or doesn't flex, poor accuracy
rows.Root Cause: Arrow spine doesn't match bow draw weight
rows.Fix/Solution: Use spine table: 40 lb bow = 0.400" spine example
rows.Prevention: Measure bow draw weight, select matching spine
rows.Quality Benchmark: Tight grouping at 20 yards, consistent impact
rows.Recovery Strategy: Switch to correct spine arrows

rows.Symptom: Arrow flight unstable, tumbles in flight
rows.Root Cause: Fletching adhesive failed or struck obstacle
rows.Fix/Solution: Inspect arrows after practice, replace fletching
rows.Prevention: Use quality adhesive, proper clamp during setting
rows.Quality Benchmark: Consistent flight, tight groupings at distance
rows.Recovery Strategy: Repair or replace fletched arrows

rows.Common Mistake: Lost animal due to lost blood trail
rows.Symptom: Game escapes, potential suffering
rows.Root Cause: Insufficient blood trail or poor bleeding
rows.Fix/Solution: Use sharp broadhead, proper placement behind front shoulder
rows.Prevention: Wait 20-30 minutes before tracking, follow droplets
rows.Quality Benchmark: Dead within 50-100 yards consistently
rows.Recovery Strategy: Improve shot placement, sharper broadheads

rows.Symptom: Meat becomes rancid, inedible
rows.Root Cause: Not cooled immediately or exposed to flies
rows.Fix/Solution: Field dress immediately, cool for 2+ hours before processing
rows.Prevention: Cool environment, keep insects off, process quickly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Meat stays fresh until processing, normal color/smell
rows.Recovery Strategy: Improve field dressing speed, cool in shade

rows.Symptom: Skin doesn't have usable leather texture
rows.Fix/Solution: Use brains/oak gall recipe, work during drying
rows.Prevention: Smoke hide, stretch continuously while drying
rows.Quality Benchmark: Soft supple leather, usable for clothing
rows.Recovery Strategy: Rewet and re-tan with proper process

rows.Common Mistake: No fish caught in chosen location
rows.Symptom: Fish not present in selected area
rows.Fix/Solution: Fish deeper pools, current breaks, shaded areas
rows.Prevention: Scout location, observe water conditions
rows.Quality Benchmark: Regular catches indicate good location
rows.Recovery Strategy: Move to other locations with better conditions

rows.Symptom: Few or no bites despite good location
rows.Fix/Solution: Use live bait matching local food sources
rows.Prevention: Observe prey in location, use matching bait
rows.Quality Benchmark: Regular bites, consistent catches
rows.Recovery Strategy: Switch bait type, use local forage items

rows.Symptom: Repeated hook/lure losses
rows.Root Cause: Line quality poor or wrong weight for fish
rows.Fix/Solution: Use weight-appropriate line, check for fraying
rows.Prevention: Inspect line after each catch, replace if damaged
rows.Quality Benchmark: Lands fish consistently without breakage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace line, use heavier test weight

rows.Symptom: Bow may break or fail during use
rows.Root Cause: Wood exposed to moisture, fungal decay
rows.Fix/Solution: Store in dry environment, inspect regularly
rows.Prevention: Maintain finish, keep wood protected
rows.Quality Benchmark: Wood stays hard and resonant when tapped
rows.Recovery Strategy: Treat with linseed oil, improve storage conditions

rows.Symptom: Trap ineffective, lost opportunities
rows.Fix/Solution: Anchor to tree/post securely, test pull strength
rows.Prevention: Multiple anchor points for tension
rows.Quality Benchmark: Snare holds animal firmly, escape impossible
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reinforce anchor, use thicker materials

rows.Symptom: Warped arrows won't fly straight
rows.Fix/Solution: Store straight in cool dry environment
rows.Prevention: Spine straightness check annually
rows.Quality Benchmark: Arrows perfectly straight, consistent flight
rows.Recovery Strategy: Replace warped arrows or straighten via steam

rows.Symptom: Cellulitis spreading, possible sepsis risk
rows.Fix/Solution: Clean wound with soap/water, apply antibiotic ointment
rows.Prevention: Cover, keep dry, monitor daily for spread
rows.Quality Benchmark: Redness stable/reducing, warmth goes away within 48hrs
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase cleaning frequency, apply stronger antibiotic

rows.Symptom: Infection indicator, potential tissue death
rows.Fix/Solution: Debride dead tissue, clean deeply, apply antibiotic
rows.Prevention: Clean daily, remove dead tissue, change dressing
rows.Quality Benchmark: Odor resolves within 3 days of treatment
rows.Recovery Strategy: Aggressive cleaning, consider systemic antibiotics

rows.Symptom: Infection progressing, may spread systemically
rows.Fix/Solution: Drain pus, clean thoroughly with saline
rows.Prevention: Daily dressing changes, clean dressing only
rows.Quality Benchmark: Pus decreases daily, odor fades within week
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase cleaning, consider oral antibiotics

rows.Symptom: Wrong or weak medicinal effect
rows.Fix/Solution: Research species, harvest correct part only
rows.Prevention: Botanical guide reference, expert identification
rows.Quality Benchmark: Expected medicinal effect achieved
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use correct plant part, verify identification

rows.Symptom: Side effects or toxicity from overdose
rows.Root Cause: Boiling time too long or material too concentrated
rows.Fix/Solution: Follow recipe ratios exactly, measure carefully
rows.Prevention: Standard: 1 part herb to 10 parts water
rows.Quality Benchmark: Expected effect without side effects
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reduce concentration, follow recipe exactly

rows.Symptom: No medicinal effect or toxin ingestion
rows.Fix/Solution: Store in dry containers, inspect before use
rows.Prevention: Clean dry storage, discard if discolored/smelly
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clear appearance, pleasant herb smell, no mold
rows.Recovery Strategy: Discard and replace with fresh herbs

rows.Common Mistake: Dosing too frequently or too high
rows.Symptom: Overdose symptoms, toxicity
rows.Fix/Solution: Use 3-4 times daily maximum, verify safety window
rows.Prevention: Document dosing schedule, use timer/calendar
rows.Quality Benchmark: Therapeutic effect without toxicity
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reduce frequency, increase interval between doses

rows.Symptom: Subtherapeutic effect, condition worsens
rows.Fix/Solution: Follow established protocols, increase to therapeutic range
rows.Prevention: Measure doses carefully, maintain schedule
rows.Quality Benchmark: Noticeable improvement in symptoms
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase dosing to therapeutic level

rows.Common Mistake: Toxic plant used instead of medicinal species
rows.Symptom: Poisoning, severe illness, potential death
rows.Fix/Solution: Definitive identification before use, use field guide
rows.Prevention: Expert confirmation, photo comparison to toxins
rows.Quality Benchmark: Correct species identification, no symptoms
rows.Recovery Strategy: Discard, positively identify before use again

rows.Symptom: Infection, abscess formation, blood-borne disease
rows.Fix/Solution: Boil instruments 10 minutes, use new needles
rows.Prevention: Autoclave or pressure cook before use
rows.Quality Benchmark: No infections after procedure
rows.Recovery Strategy: Sterilize equipment properly before use

rows.Symptom: Dysentery, giardia, cryptosporidium illness
rows.Fix/Solution: Boil 1 minute, use filter + disinfection
rows.Prevention: Filter + bleach (2 drops/quart) or iodine
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clear water, no illness after drinking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Always treat water before consuming

rows.Symptom: Infection risk, traps heat, increases damage
rows.Fix/Solution: Cool with water 15 minutes, apply clean dry bandage
rows.Prevention: Remove source, cool immediately, keep clean
rows.Quality Benchmark: Healing without infection, minimal scarring
rows.Recovery Strategy: Cool properly, use antibiotic ointment instead

rows.Symptom: Afterdrop (temperature continues dropping), cardiac issues
rows.Fix/Solution: Passive external rewarming, warm fluids slowly
rows.Prevention: Gradual warming, avoid rapid temperature changes
rows.Quality Benchmark: Body temperature stabilizes and rises steadily
rows.Recovery Strategy: Slow gradual warming process

rows.Common Mistake: Drinking too much plain water at once
rows.Symptom: Hyponatremia, water intoxication, seizures
rows.Fix/Solution: Add salt/electrolytes to water, drink gradually
rows.Prevention: Electrolyte solution: water + salt + sugar
rows.Quality Benchmark: Thirst satisfied, normal cognition, steady vitals
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use electrolyte drinks, don't drink plain water exclusively

rows.Symptom: Infection worsens, odor develops
rows.Fix/Solution: Change daily or when dressing becomes damp
rows.Prevention: Dry dressing, proper coverage
rows.Quality Benchmark: Clean dry wound, no odor, healing proceeds
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase dressing change frequency

rows.Symptom: Weak cordage breaks under light load
rows.Root Cause: Fibers matted or tangled, poor alignment
rows.Fix/Solution: Properly card/comb fibers, remove debris
rows.Prevention: Fibers aligned parallel, smooth
rows.Quality Benchmark: Cordage withstands 100+ lbs tension without breaking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Prepare fibers better, test strength

rows.Symptom: Cordage stretches excessively, weak
rows.Fix/Solution: Tight spinning, multiple twist passes
rows.Prevention: Visual check: compact dense cordage
rows.Quality Benchmark: Minimal stretch under load, strong pull-test
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase twist ratio, re-spin tighter

rows.Symptom: Breaks at thin spots under load
rows.Fix/Solution: Consistent tension, even feed rate
rows.Prevention: Uniform diameter throughout length
rows.Quality Benchmark: Even strength throughout, no weak points
rows.Recovery Strategy: Spin with consistent tension control

rows.Symptom: Uneven yarn, thread breakage during spinning
rows.Fix/Solution: Reduce wheel speed, better hand control
rows.Prevention: Smooth consistent motion
rows.Quality Benchmark: Uniform yarn diameter, no breaks
rows.Recovery Strategy: Slow wheel speed, practice consistency

rows.Symptom: Yarn too loose, weak, untwisted
rows.Fix/Solution: Increase wheel speed, maintain draw rate
rows.Prevention: Even twist throughout yarn
rows.Quality Benchmark: Strong yarn, minimal stretch
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase wheel speed appropriately

rows.Symptom: Finished fabric sags, uneven weave
rows.Fix/Solution: Tighten tensioning screws/system
rows.Prevention: Warp straight under light tension
rows.Quality Benchmark: Flat even fabric without waves
rows.Recovery Strategy: Increase warp tension

rows.Symptom: Loom frame stress, warp breaks
rows.Fix/Solution: Reduce tension to medium-firm
rows.Prevention: Warp firm but not straining
rows.Quality Benchmark: Intact warp threads, no breakage
rows.Recovery Strategy: Reduce tension slightly

rows.Symptom: Color weak or uneven, poor uptake
rows.Root Cause: Dye not activated or fiber damaged
rows.Fix/Solution: Use correct temperature for dye type (natural vs synthetic)
rows.Prevention: Follow dye instructions, monitor temperature
rows.Quality Benchmark: Rich even color, good color saturation
rows.Recovery Strategy: Use proper temperature for dye type

rows.Symptom: Blotchy color, some areas light/dark
rows.Root Cause: Fiber not moving in dye bath
rows.Fix/Solution: Stir constantly, move fibers, ensure submersion
rows.Prevention: Continuous movement, even exposure
rows.Quality Benchmark: Uniform color throughout all fibers
rows.Recovery Strategy: Improve agitation, move fibers constantly

rows.Symptom: Spun yarn has weak spots from unmixed fibers
rows.Fix/Solution: Card multiple times, blend thoroughly
rows.Prevention: Uniform mixed color in carded wool
rows.Quality Benchmark: Even yarn, consistent properties throughout
rows.Recovery Strategy: Card more times, ensure complete blending

rows.Symptom: Fabric tears easily, lacks durability
rows.Fix/Solution: Tighter weave, more threads, closer spacing
rows.Prevention: Visual inspection, hand feel for density
rows.Quality Benchmark: Durable fabric resists tearing under normal use
rows.Recovery Strategy: Weave tighter or use more threads

rows.Symptom: Rim breaks or becomes loose
rows.Fix/Solution: Double/triple rim with tight binding
rows.Prevention: Visible strong rim structure, no flex
rows.Quality Benchmark: Rim survives rough handling, no cracking
rows.Recovery Strategy: Strengthen rim with additional wrapping
